visualization_prompt: Generate a spline chart showing monthly trends of renewable energy production (solar vs. wind) using synthetic time-series data with seasonal patterns
visualization_explanation: The dataset contains two time series (solar and wind energy production) with 12 monthly observations each. Synthetic data follows seasonal patterns: solar production peaks in summer (μ=20,500 MWh, σ=4,200) while wind production peaks in winter (μ=18,300 MWh, σ=2,600), incorporating realistic capacity factors and inverse seasonality. A spline chart was selected to emphasize continuous trends while minimizing visual clutter, adhering to Tufte's data-ink ratio principles. Color choices (#e67e22 for solar, #3498db for wind) follow Cairo's perceptual effectiveness for categorical distinction. The dual-axis spline facilitates direct comparison of phase-shifted seasonal patterns through smooth curve interpolation between monthly data points.
